file_content.text: I was watching the reactor readouts. We live to fight another day, thanks to you.
So, is Tykan dead?
He gave me no choice, and now the Jedi Order has lost a great Master.
Unfortunately.
But he's no longer terrorizing Taris either. You did a good thing, Jedi.
I did what was necessary. There is justice for those Tykan killed.
Yes. Your men are avenged.
Either way, the psycho's dead, and I can breathe easy again.
Tykan was a unique challenge, almost worthy of my skills.
I enjoyed fighting him.
Good. Then everybody's happy.
I haven't heard from his Padawan yet. Is she with you?
Aris died alongside her Master.
She's gone.
Aris wouldn't answer any questions before she left. Can't imagine what she's going through.
Master Tykan has been freed from his illness. He's on his way back to Tython.
He's cured.
Jedi aren't murderers. I've ensured Master Tykan won't hurt anyone else.
I never intended to kill him.
I'm not one of your soldiers, I don't kill on command. Tykan's sane again, and he's going home.
Don't presume, Captain.
What? Are you sick in the head, too? How could you let him go after what he did?
Only a living man can truly atone for what he's done.
He can be redeemed.
Oh great, Jedi wisdom. But my men are still dead.
Don't Republic soldiers swear to defend the innocent? Tykan is a victim, as much as your men were.
Because it wasn't his fault.
The difference being, Tykan's still breathing.
Your job was to aid me in finding Master Tykan. The rest is my business.
That's not your concern.
I'll make it my business if Tykan ever sets foot on this planet again!
Where's his Padawan? I imagine she's thrilled about all this.
She was falling to the dark side, and she wouldn't see reason.
I couldn't save her.
Aris was... misguided. She died trying to defend her Master.
She's dead.
She wasn't Tykan's hostage, she was willing to help him kill everyone. I had to stop her.
Aris was a traitor.
Ah, damn it. She had her whole life in front of her. It's not fair.
I got Aris's checkpoint signal. You're careful about keeping your own people alive, I see.
Oh. While you were gone, Master Syo Bakarn contacted me. He's waiting to hear from you.
I'll contact him at once. Keep up the good work, Captain.
Thank you. Take care.
The Council will want a full report on this.
Then I should go.
Great. I never get a moment's peace.
How tedious.
Try being in the army sometime.
Thanks again for stopping that menace. I'll rest a lot easier with him gone.
Don't take your eye off Tykan. You let him live, you're responsible for whatever he does next.
Good hunting, Jedi.
Tykan will kill us all if you don't get to the reactor in time!
Damn. These records have those rakghoul tunnels all plotted out. Tykan knew exactly how to hit us.
Is wise to know the territory before hunt begins.
And--looks like one of Taris's super-reactors is still operational. It's damaged, leaking toxic waste into the ecosystem.
From these readouts, it would only take a little push to send the reactor into total meltdown. And Tykan copied every file on its processes.
If the super-reactor went into meltdown, what kind of damage could it cause?
Worst-case scenario?
Please tell me this super-reactor is a thousand kilometers out in the middle of nowhere.
Give me some good news.
Sorry. But it's in the middle of reclaimed territory.
He's certainly persistent.
If the reactor blows, we're looking at a chemical detonation that could take out the Republic's entire occupied area on Taris.
If we're lucky. The chain reaction could turn this whole planet into a hydrocarbon-fueled inferno.
Tharan, don't talk like that. You're scaring me.
Tykan's access code is all over these records. This isn't some vendetta, Jedi, this is genocide!
Master Tykan's actions are an affront to the Force. He has to be stopped.
No one else dies.
Stopped? If you get the chance, take him down!
I can stop him.
Tykan's not getting away again. Whatever his plan is, I'm ending it.
I'm finishing this.
Good. Make him pay for what he's done!
Here's the super-reactor's coordinates. Please, let me know once you've handled Tykan--my men deserve to be told.
And remember, Tykan's still holding his Padawan hostage. Watch your back.
Thanks. Now we can treat the wounded without rakghouls pouring in.
But Tykan's long gone. Aris, that poor kid... he dragged her out there with him.
The Force is with us. The Junction's security chief gave me this.
I have a lead.
We may be able to find them. Can your computers decrypt this datapad?
We're getting her back.
Instead of weeping and wailing, maybe we could try something useful?
Shut up and listen.
What's this? Infrastructure data? Maybe we can corner Tykan after all.
Please... seal the tunnels. We won't survive another rakghoul attack.
Captain Nelex? What happened here?
Are you alright?
Should have known you'd... make it past those things.
Tunnels... Tykan must have found rakghoul tunnels under the base. He set those things on my men and... the little Padawan! Aris--Tykan took her!
Where would Master Tykan take Aris?
Where would he go?
Could be anywhere. He knows this planet like the back of his hand.
Don't worry. Aris is a Padawan, she can defend herself.
Aris is strong.
Against a Jedi Master? He's... so far gone. What if he hurts her?
And what were you doing while an innocent Padawan was abducted, Captain?
You let him kidnap her?
Those things... were swarming all over us! One minute she was helping, the next she was gone!
All these people, dead... forget a trial! I want Tykan's head for this!
If you don't calm your anger, it will consume you.
Revenge is a dark path.
How can I be calm when my men are--
This isn't Tykan's doing. Not really. He's very sick.
Tykan's not himself.
Now you're making excuses? Aris was--
Your men are gone. Move on.
But my people came here to help this planet. They--
Wait. The tunnels are still open. You have to seal the tunnel entrances before those things come back.
Please, check the base and seal those tunnels. Or the wounded are just... food for the rakghouls.
Those people are in good hands. See to your injuries, I'll take care of everything.
I'll save your men.
Don't worry, I'm on it.
One way or another, those things are going back underground.
I'll handle the rakghouls.
Thanks... and hurry.
Come in, Jedi! Do you read me?
Good to hear from you, Captain. I might have a lead on Master Tykan.
Yes, I do.
Belay that! We've got bigger problems!
What's wrong?
I'm already on my way back to base, Captain. Hold that thought until I get there.
Can this wait?
No, there's no time!
The base is under attack! Tykan got the jump on us! We need you back here ASAP, we've got--
Scorekeeper calls us through the soft one, Herald. Many points ahead, I think.
I need you to watch my back. Tykan's volatile in the extreme.
Just keep your eyes open.
Kaleesh is great hunter. But his points are not earned well. We must stop this, Herald.
The captain asked for help, and you're thinking of your score?
That's all you care about?
Score is life. Hunter without a score is just a rock that breathes. Now, we go?
Good. I like to keep your Scorekeeper busy.
I'm looking forward to it.
You are truly her Herald. Let us honor her in battle.
This Tykan fellow's persistent. Just how many bolt-holes does he have?
He knows Taris inside out. Nobody will be safe until we catch him.
Too many.
Then may I suggest we pursue our quarry with all due haste?
Tykan's knowledge of Taris is amazing. Imagine what we could do with it.
I'd love to know.
For now, let's just get this psychopath pinned down, shall we?
It doesn't matter. Wherever he goes on this planet, I'll find him.
Not enough to escape us.
An admirable sentiment, from an admirable woman. Let's go.
That's the spirit. Let's get moving.
Keep your eyes open. Tykan used the Junction in his restoration effort. There might be a clue to stopping him there.
Please don't hurt Master Tykan. He's the only one who could save Taris. And... I need him, to explain all this to me.
Jedi, we just got a call from the expedition. They said you helped them out, but the rest sounds crazy.
Tykan attacking them, a couple of survivors? From a twelve-man team? Tell me that's wrong!
Master Tykan lured the expedition into a trap.
It's right.
Unfortunately, most of the expedition is dead. And Master Tykan is responsible.
I have some bad news.
Tykan's lost it. He trapped them, set a fire nearby and ran off.
He did more than attack.
No! What if he was trying to lead them to safety? They ignored him and wandered off!
It's only natural to defend your Master, Aris, but a Jedi seeks the truth in all matters.
You must face reality.
You have my sympathies, Aris. I watched my own Master suffer like this.
I know this is hard to accept.
Don't be so stupid.
I want him found--found and brought to justice, even if I have to drag him back myself!
No, please! None of this is his fault!
We can debate this later. For now, my best lead on Master Tykan is the Junction.
This isn't helping.
Master Tykan needs help. The survivors said he was headed to the Junction.
You're right, Padawan.
Don't worry, I should be able to corner Master Tykan. He's headed to the Junction.
I agree with the captain.
Damn him. The Junction's a gas trap full of civilian workers!
My men need help! You've got to find that expedition!
This is crazy. We'd have noticed any unusual activity from Master Tykan, but the Council says we--
Ah, here she is. I'm Captain Nelex, Republic Expeditionary Forces.
Here he is, just in time. Captain Nelex, with the Republic Expeditionary Forces.
I haven't encountered the Expeditionary Forces before. What are your duties on Taris?
What exactly do you do?
We scout the area, monitor pollution and handle the local wildlife--emphasis on "wild"--with Master Tykan's help.
Hello.
Pleasure's mine. My men will be glad there's another Jedi around, Master Tykan's been a big help.
I'm sure your rank impresses the locals, but I'll take things from here.
Back off, soldier.
Uh... yes, sir. You're, uh, more assertive than Master Tykan.
This has to be a mix-up. My Master is a renowned Kaleesh scout, a truly gifted pathfinder. I--oops, Padawan Aris Vauranelle, at your service.
You seem quite certain that the Council's mistaken.
Doubting the Council?
No, no, I'd never question the Council. But my Master's just not sick.
I have to see your Master, Aris. If he's ill, only the Force can heal him.
Tykan might need my help.
But that's what we don't understand. Master Tykan isn't ill at all.
Padawans speak when spoken to. Or has Master Tykan neglected your training?
Be quiet.
Of course not! And there's nothing wrong with him!
She's right. When the Council called, Master Tykan had just left with a research expedition. If he's gone rogue, it's news to us.
Where is that expedition now?
Are they back yet?
Those pollution readings take ages to compile. They're not due back for days.
I'd like to diagnose Master Tykan in person.
I should talk to him anyway.
Sure. The Council wouldn't send you if they didn't think their intel was good, right?
You should have brought them back the second the Council called you.
That expedition's at risk!
Look, the Council's on Tython, but I see Tykan everyday. Who would you believe?
Regardless, I'm sure Master Tykan will want to meet you. I'll try and reach him.
Captain! Captain Nelex! We need backup! They're gone, sir, they're all gone! Captain! Can you read me?
What the--? That's the expedition guardsman--Sergeant Valoy! Where's Tykan?
There must have been an accident. Those ruins are always shifting.
Their transmission got out. The team might still be okay.
We need to get to them.
If Master Tykan's not answering, something must have gone badly wrong.
There's more to this.
I'm beginning to understand why the Republic restoration effort is taking so long.
So much for Republic training.
I'll get a rescue team scrambled--no, damn, I'll never get them out there in time!
Give me their location. Whatever happened, the Force will protect me.
I can save them.
Then let's hope it can protect my men, too.
Take a deep breath, Captain. I'll get those men back safely.
Don't panic. I'll handle this.
Yes. Right. Thank you.
I'm here to find Tykan; I can't get sidetracked just because your people are careless.
I have bigger concerns.
He's with that expedition! If you want to find him, you have to save those men!
Meantime, I'll put a team together. Here, take a copy of the expedition's map to guide you. Watch yourself--there's more than pollution in those swamps.
Master Tykan's out in them, too. I hope the Force is watching you both, for Taris's sake.
